author: Daniel Greene
description:
Writing a book is hard—writing a fourth book? Even harder. In this video, I dive into my experience writing Better Dead, my upcoming fourth book, and how everything I learned from my first three (Breach of Peace, Rebels Creed, and Neon Ghosts) shaped the way I approached storytelling, worldbuilding, and character development.

Whether you're an aspiring author looking to learn from my mistakes or a reader curious about the behind-the-scenes of writing a book, this video will take you through the highs, the lows, and the lessons that made Better Dead my most ambitious project yet.

📖 What You’ll Learn in This Video:

The biggest lessons I learned from writing Breach of Peace, Rebels Creed, and Neon Ghosts
What I changed in my writing process for Better Dead
How I approach worldbuilding, pacing, and character arcs differently now
The mistakes I made early on—and how I fixed them
Advice for aspiring writers who want to write their first book
🎥 Want More Writing & Book Content?

Neon Gho
title: What Writing 4 Books Taught Me (& What I Wish I Knew Sooner)
